description: End users may experience unauthorized remote code execution when connecting to the Windows Routing and Remote Access Service (RRAS). This vulnerability, associated with CVE-2024-30022, can lead to potential loss of confidentiality, integrity, and availability of system resources. Observations include unexpected behaviors such as unauthorized application launches or tasks running without user initiation, particularly on affected systems with build numbers 10.0.19045.4412, 10.0.22631.3593, 10.0.22621.3593, and 10.0.22000.2960. Users are advised to monitor their systems for unauthorized changes and ensure they have applied the updates detailed in KB-5037788, KB-5037771, KB-5037770, and KB-5037768 to mitigate these risks.
